title: Bug 12906[Editor Mgmt] Cannot open file in another editor if it is already opened in one editor (should give error message)
description: When a file is already opened in one editor, it should not be possible to open it in another editor. Currently, no warning or error message is displayed. When attempting to open the file with another editor, nothing happens. We believe this behavior is a safety feature to prevent external editing while the file is already open in the workspace.
OB:
1. Close the file if it is already open.
2. Go to the Java Perspective.
3. Open a Java file by double-clicking on it.
4. The file is now opened in the workbench.
5. Right-click on the Java file.
6. Select 'Open With' -> 'System Editor'.
7. Nothing happens.
EB: When attempting to open a file in another editor while it is already opened in one editor, a warning message should be displayed. The warning should notify the user that they may overwrite unsaved changes and ask if they want to continue. Alternatively, an error message should be displayed indicating that all files need to be closed before opening the file in another editor.
SR:
1. Close the file if it is already open.
2. Go to the Java Perspective.
3. Open a Java file by double-clicking on it.
4. The file is now opened in the workbench.
5. Right-click on the Java file.
6. Select 'Open With' -> 'System Editor'.
7. Verify that a warning message is displayed, asking if the user wants to continue opening the file in the system editor. OR
7. Verify that an error message is displayed, indicating that all files need to be closed before opening the file in another editor.
